trans-unit.source: Setting the Prefer Header to Manage Response Echo on Insert Operations
trans-unit.target: Setting the Prefer Header to Manage Response Echo on Insert Operations

trans-unit.source: By default, the <link xlink:href="e7b7c22f-39d1-46b1-9f3a-0ccaeabde95a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Table (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="9ca046aa-e9b4-4eaf-a7c0-d6ccdbaf48b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Insert Entity (REST API)</link> operations return a response payload that echoes the data contained in the request body.
trans-unit.target: By default, the <link xlink:href="e7b7c22f-39d1-46b1-9f3a-0ccaeabde95a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Table (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="9ca046aa-e9b4-4eaf-a7c0-d6ccdbaf48b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Insert Entity (REST API)</link> operations return a response payload that echoes the data contained in the request body.

trans-unit.source: For version 2013-08-15 and higher of the storage services and OData data service version 3.0, it is possible to omit the response body echo by setting the <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header to <codeInline>return-no-content</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For version 2013-08-15 and higher of the storage services and OData data service version 3.0, it is possible to omit the response body echo by setting the <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header to <codeInline>return-no-content</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header is set to <codeInline>return-no-content</codeInline>, the service will respond with status code 204 (<languageKeyword>No Content</languageKeyword>) and response header <parameterReference>Preference-Applied:</parameterReference> <codeInline>return-no-content</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header is set to <codeInline>return-no-content</codeInline>, the service will respond with status code 204 (<languageKeyword>No Content</languageKeyword>) and response header <parameterReference>Preference-Applied:</parameterReference> <codeInline>return-no-content</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: You can also set the <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header to <codeInline>return-content</codeInline>, which provides the default behavior of returning the response payload.
trans-unit.target: You can also set the <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header to <codeInline>return-content</codeInline>, which provides the default behavior of returning the response payload.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the service will respond with status code 201 (<languageKeyword>Created</languageKeyword>) and response header <parameterReference>Preference-Applied:</parameterReference> <codeInline>return-content</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the service will respond with status code 201 (<languageKeyword>Created</languageKeyword>) and response header <parameterReference>Preference-Applied:</parameterReference> <codeInline>return-content</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If no <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header is specified, the service responds with status code 201 (<languageKeyword>Created</languageKeyword>) without the <parameterReference>Preference-Applied</parameterReference> header in the response.
trans-unit.target: If no <parameterReference>Prefer</parameterReference> header is specified, the service responds with status code 201 (<languageKeyword>Created</languageKeyword>) without the <parameterReference>Preference-Applied</parameterReference> header in the response.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see the documentation for the <externalLink><linkText>OData Prefer header</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh537533.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see the documentation for the <externalLink><linkText>OData Prefer header</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh537533.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
